text:
Fantastic food, superb service. 
I'm a brunch connaisseur. Been around multiple spots in and around Montreal, this place just made it in my top 3.

We were 10 ppl + 2 kids,  came in unanounced on a Sunday at noon. Owner was very accommodating and went above and beyond to get us seated fast. The amount of dishes in the menu is impressive. We all got our plates at the same time, kitchen staff is very organized. Our whole group was veey pleased. I will definitely be back. BEST FRENCH TOAST IVE EVER HAD, you must try it!

Tout d'abord la serveuse n'a pas l'expérience requise pour ce genre d'établissement. J'ai commandé un déjeuner simple, ce que j'ai reçu était bien présente mais la saucisse était froide, j'ai demandé à ce que l'on me serve de la saucisse chaude, la serveuse semblait plus que perplexe ça se voyait dans son visage . Elle est parti vers la cuisine avec mon assiette et j'ai reçu après ce qui m'a semblé 5 à 6 minutes mon repas bien chaud. Mais là un autre problème elle a omis de me rapporter des rôties chaudes car les miennes étaient devenues froides après toute cette attente.Je lui en fait la demande et elle semble surprise!!! J'attends encore un bon moment pour enfin la voir me rapporter mes rôties, mais mon repas à refroidi et j'en ai plein mon casque, de plus  les rôties étaient encore froides ça ne prend pas tant de temps en faire n'est-ce- pas??? 
 Et o n  ne mentionnera pas le fait que les fèves au lard sont servi au coût de 3$ dans un petit mais tout petit pot???!!!
Pour tout vous dire l'expérience n'en valait pas le prix, suggestion au proprio trouver du personnel qualifié serait une priorité , elle était jolie mais vraiment pas allumée .....
The BEST breakfast place in Saint-Sauveur!  A must for brunch if your in the area!  Ambience, service and food are all fantastic with amazing gluten-free options!
A bit on expensive side, but so worth it! Delicious brunch, especially the egg benedicts with mushrooms and foie gras. Their smoothies are also very good.

Au départ, je dois dire que j'étais triste de ne plus avoir le petit café de la gare pour mes visites à St-So. 

Toutefois je agréablement surprise et charmée par le passé composé. Un peu moins rustique comme ambiance, certes, mais tout de même au niveau concernant la bouffe et le service. 

Délicieux bénédictine au jambon sur l'os accompagné d'un délicieux café. Le tout servi agréablement par une serveuse charmante. (Désolée je ne me souviens pas du nom!)

Leur menu brunch est à se rouler par terre de décadence et le prix en vaut largement la chandelle. Je recommande !

J' avais presque le le gout de lui donner une note parfaite car ce fut le cas.
Premièrement belle accueil a la porte par ce qui semble être la gérante et ensuite tous les employés que nous croisons nous saluent également.
j' ai commandé une omelette aux asperges et un cappuccino et mon amie elle un uf sauce Gaspard. Tout était parfait. chaud et avec une belle présentation. le service est impeccable, gentil et efficace. Tres belle salle a manger et une belle terrasse donne sur l' avenue de la gare.

One of the most tasteful brunch I've ever had, although the prices are definitely on the higher end, but it is absolutely worth it. 

Visited on a Saturday morning for brunch and we got seated right away. I went for the duck poached eggs which is a butternut squash "muffin", duck confit on it, topped with the poached egg. It comes with a side or either salad, fruits or potatoes. 

The poached egg was perfectly cooked, the duck confit and butternut squash compliment exquisitely the egg and it altogether makes for a truly unique plate with lots of flavor. The sauce is delicious and the potatoes and chips are also very good. I highly recommend this dish. 

The prices are what most would consider expensive for a brunch, for the simple reason that you pay per egg that you order. The duck poached egg was $15 for one egg or $23 for two eggs. Being one of the most satisfying brunch I've had, I think it is definitely worth the price.
Went on Sunday and was served by le Café de la Gare. Worst breakfast ever. Took over an hour for 2 eggs, bacon, 1 crepe and white bread.  They even didnt come all at once. Avoid this place on Sunday!
Not only was the food amazing, they even had live entertainment. There was a bit of a wait but well worth it.
Amazing food. Really great service. Was recommended by our hotel and they got it spot on. Delicious and everyone should try it

J'ai commandé les ufs pochés au canard confit. 
Le service est excellent.
La nourriture est délicieuse avec des ingrédients originaux (canard confit dans des ufs pochés).
Le prix est un peu plus élevés que la norme mais la sélection du menu est originale (ingrédients différents).

My boyfriend and I were visiting Montreal for a long weekend and had gotten a recommendation to try this place. When we first got there on a Sunday around noon, the line was way out the door which we took as a good sign but also not sure we wanted to wait that long. However, after peaking in the window and seeing the food, as well as taking a look at a menu, we decided to wait it out. It took about 45 minutes to be seated but it was well worth the wait!!! The server was perfectly lovely and took extra care to make a cappuccino just the way I like it (so much so that I ordered a second one). Then the food was simply spectacular, possibly the best brunch I've ever had. I got the "oeuf poché campêtre" which was their take of an eggs Benedict (with pesto and mushrooms) and it was amazing! My boyfriend got "le du passé composé" which was a perfect variety of breakfast foods (eggs, bacon, beans, fruit, ham) with a choice of toast or french toast. I'm not sure exactly how they made this French toast but it was definitely the best French toast I've ever had. It had a crispy outside with I think flaked coconut and a soft, warm inside without being too sweet. Next time we come to Montreal, we'll happily wait in line and eat here again!

Great food
Great service
Pretty good atmosphere and interior
Great coffee 
Worth the try! I enjoyed it!
